greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = (-1)^k * A119258(n,k) read by rows, 0 <= k <= n.
comment: A145661, A119258 and A118801 are all essentially the same (see the Shattuck and Waldhauser paper). - Tamas Waldhauser, Jul 25 2011
link: J.-F. Chamayou, A Random Difference Equation with Dufresne Variables Revisited, arXiv preprint arXiv:1410.1708 [math.PR], 2014. See Table in Section XII.
M. Shattuck and T. Waldhauser, Proofs of some binomial identities using the method of last squares, Fib. Quart., 48 (2010), 290-297.
maple: if k=0 or k = n then
elif k<0 or k> n then
mathematica: Clear[M, T, d, a, x, a0];
M[d_] := MatrixPower[Table[T[n, m, d], {n, 1, d}, {m, 1, d}], d];
xref: A193844 is an essentially identical triangle.
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 16 2009
